intro: Stenoloma angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stenoloma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like blades that are typically narrow and elongated. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and soil organisms.
